conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a bisexuality movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I'd highly recommend watching "Frida" if you're interested in a bisexuality movie. This biographical film follows the life of renowned artist Frida Kahlo, brilliantly portrayed by Salma Hayek. The movie explores her complex personal life and tumultuous relationship with fellow artist Diego Rivera. It's a captivating tale of passion, resilience, and self-expression.

If you're up for something more contemporary, "Restless" is another intriguing choice. This film follows the burgeoning romance between two teenagers who both grapple with loss and find solace in each other amidst a backdrop of rebellion and self-discovery. Enjoy!

On the other hand, "The Rocky Horror Picture Show" offers an unforgettable mix of music, comedy, and camp, starring Tim Curry as the eccentric Dr. Frank-n-Furter. Both films are quite unique and could appeal to your taste! Enjoy the viewing experience!

On the other hand, "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid" follows the adventures of two outlaws on the run after a heist goes wrong, offering a tale of friendship and resilience in the face of adversity.

Alternatively, "Smilla's Sense of Snow" (1997) is another captivating movie that revolves around a half-Inuit woman investigating the mysterious death of a young boy. Julia Ormond delivers an engaging portrayal in this intriguing mystery set between Copenhagen and Greenland. Enjoy!

Another film you might enjoy is "Space Cowboys." Directed by Clint Eastwood, it tells the story of retired astronauts who are called back into space to save a failing satellite. With an all-star cast including Tommy Lee Jones and James Garner, it's a fun mix of action and nostalgia.
